thread.title: Tulsa blows lead, rallies to beat Louisiana-Monroe 34-24
thread.title_full: Tulsa blows lead, rallies to beat Louisiana-Monroe 34-24

title: Tulsa blows lead, rallies to beat Louisiana-Monroe 34-24
text:
Tulsa blows lead before Evans rallies Tulsa to 34-24 win over Louisiana-Monroe THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   10:24   10:25   
People: 
Louisiana (850) 

TULSA, Oklahoma â€” Dane Evans threw for 341 yards and two touchdowns in rallying Tulsa to a 34-24 victory over Louisiana-Monroe on Saturday night. 
Louisiana-Monroe (1-4) scored 17 straight points in the third quarter to lead 24-20. But Matt Linscott's interception gave the Golden Hurricane (3-2) the ball at the Louisiana-Monroe 29, and two plays later Evans threw to D'Angelo Brewer for the go-ahead score with 8:41 left. The Warhawks fumbled on the ensuing kickoff and eight plays later Tulsa scored on Zack Langer's second 1-run touchdown. 
Evans was 28 of 44 and moved to sixth on Tulsa's career passing TD list with 37. 
Louisiana-Monroe's Garrett Smith was 25 of 48 for 231 yards and a score to Ajalen Holley, who had 113 yards receiving. 
The game marked the return of Todd Berry to his alma mater as Warhawks head coach. It also came a week after the sudden death of Warhawks walk-on quarterback Daniel Fitzwater.
